intro: Mollugo nudicaulis var. navassensis, commonly known as Navassé's sandpennywort, is a low-growing annual herb native to arid regions of the southwestern United States. It typically features prostrate stems with small, fleshy, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in ecological studies of desert flora.
